Issues.Title: Bulma 0.9.1 causing issues with body scroll lock
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help?
Bug with bulma 

<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->
It's happening in browser

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
### Description

Let's say you have a button. When you click on the button a popup/modal is opened. When the modal/opens, the background content should not be scrollable. Only the modal should be scrollable. When you implement this feature with bulma. The issue I'm having is with the body scroll lock. When the modal is open, I'm still able to scroll the body. Only the modal should be scrollable.

I've created a simple example of my scenario on code sandbox `https://codesandbox.io/s/bulma-nextjs-contextual-routing-with-modal-9bifu?file=/pages/index.js`

After digging through bulma code base, it looks like these two lines in` bulma/base/generic.sass`
```
html
  overflow-y: $body-overflow-y
  overflow-x: $body-overflow-x
```

is causing the issue. After removing those two lines, it starts working.


### Expected behavior

When modal opens, background content should not be scrollable. Only the modal content should be scrollable.

### Actual behavior

The background content is scrollable
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bulma 0.9.1 causing issues with body scroll lock" (#3250)

Issues.Title: Broken extends.sass import with release 0.9.2
Issues.Body:
Following breaking advice from latest release don't work:
> To fix duplicate imports, all Sass placeholders have moved from the utilities/mixins file to its own utilities/extends file. If you were importing them directly from utilities/mixins, you'll need to import utilities/extends instead.

The `control` mixin is require in [**extends.sass** ](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/c5edaea84f289b1e92f406b6d38de40970262e46/sass/utilities/extends.sass#L4) but it is not imported with `mixins.sass`. This mixin is located in `controls.sass`, so this file should also be imported.

Issues.Title: fix: increase contrast between disabled input text and background flood
Issues.Body: This is a **improvement**. The current color contrast for disabled form inputs is below legibility standards (WCAG AA) of 4.5:1: ### Proposed solution Use `$grey-darker` for the text color of disable inputs, as the lack of interactivity, disabled cursor, and gray background all work to reinforce that the input is, in fact, disabled. The outcome still looks disabled but is now more legible and has better objective contrast: ### Tradeoffs This seems like a straightforward accessibility win. There may be a minor risk of users attempting to interact with the disabled field, but it should present much less of legibility issue especially for users with less-than-perfect eyesight. ### Testing Done Verified build output with codepen by pasting in the output of `npm run build` (bulma.min.css) and rendering code samples from input and text area docs: [https://codepen.io/alanguir/pen/qBavxGK](https://codepen.io/alanguir/pen/qBavxGK) ### Changelog updated? Issues.Title: Feature request: basic styles mode
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview

Addition of a mode (body class switch?) whereby basic browser defaults are not neutralized.

### Description

Understand many, perhaps most, want to use Bulma to start a project from a neutral, reset, full control state whereby all margins, font sizes and other simple basics - mostly default browser styles - are neutralized. Then use the declarative class approach.

**_Some may not want that_**. If you just want to throw Bulma at a single/simple page, for example, and get the basics of a page that may benefit from simplicity of some browser defaults whilst also allowing the addition of Bulma features later, such as notifications for one example, would it be possible to provide a variation of the default mode for such use cases?

### Steps to Reproduce

Take the basic https://bulma.io/documentation/overview/start/#starter-template

Add significant paragraphs, headings to generate a very simple page without any header, sidebar or other layout. Perhaps using lorum ipsum.

Remove arguably excess / unnecessary classes such as `h1 class=title`, `h2 class=subtitle`.

### Expected behavior

Basic browser default heading font styles - size, weight, margins - are maintained instead of an unreadable state.

### Actual behavior

Headings are indistinguishable from paragraph text.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature request: basic styles mode" (#3232)

The "Learn how" link on the [Customize/Variables#generic-variables](https://bulma.io/documentation/customize/variables/#generic-variables) page/section should send to a page that teaches how to change variables, but it just sends back to the root of the Customize branch in the docs.

### Proposed Solution

This PR changes the link to direct the user to sass doc on variables. (https://sass-lang.com/documentation/variables)

### Testing Done

None.
